Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion (passes through pores due to smaller size)

Other Information.Test Conditions: Enrichment in NH4HCO3 buffer (50 mM) at 37 °C
Other Information.Additional Info: Captured by boric acid affinity and pass through material while larger proteins are excluded.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion (blocked by pores due to larger size)

Other Information.Additional Info: Larger than glycopeptides, hence excluded by the material's size-exclusion effect.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion based on differential molecular size, allowing passage of smaller glycopeptides while blocking larger intact proteins.

Experimental Validation.Method: MALDI-TOF MS analysis of eluent and supernatant after enrichment
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Intact HRP protein signals absent in eluent, present in supernatant, confirming size-exclusion performance.

Other Information.Additional Info: Covalent Organic Framework (COF) material; core-shell structured magnetic nanoparticles; functionalized with polyethyleneimine (PEI) and 4-methoxyphenylboronic acid (boric acid); primarily used for N-glycopeptide enrichment via boric acid affinity chemistry; demonstrated good reusability (ten cycles), low detection limit (0.5 fmol·μL−1), and high loading capacity (80 μg·mg−1).
